original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares edge up in mid day trade
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares edged up in mid-day trade on rather slow sentiments as investors are taking a wait and see approach on possible rate cuts at the Monetary Policy, analysts said.
“Investors are also waiting on clarity on the International Monetary Fund loan facility” an analyst said.
All Share Price Index was up 0.05 percent or 4.60 points to 9,194.03, the most liquid index S&P SL20 was up 0.08 percent or 3.34 points to 2,801.03.
The market generated a moderate turnover of 875 million rupees.
Top gainers were Sampath Bank, Bukit Darah and Aitken Spence. (Colombo/Feb28/2023)
